summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and the inmate to whom discovery materials are being sent.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting discovery.

connections.description: Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution and discovery process in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of July 2021.
The letter is signed by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, indicating her office's direct involvement in the case at that time.
